intro: Bernoullia heterophyla, commonly known as the variable mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of eucalyptus trees in southern Australia. It has a distinctive appearance with its fleshy, leathery leaves and small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for native birds. Its life cycle involves both asexual and sexual reproduction, with seeds dispersed by birds. Bernoullia heterophyla plays a significant ecological role in its native habitat, supporting biodiversity through its interactions with host trees and wildlife.
